Notes.Text:
This update for ipsec-tools fixes one issue.

This security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2016-10396: The racoon daemon contained a remotely exploitable
  computational-complexity attack when parsing and storing ISAKMP fragments that
  allowed a remote attacker to exhaust computational resources on the remote
  endpoint by repeatedly sending ISAKMP fragment packets in a particular order
  (bsc#1047443).

This update was imported from the SUSE:SLE-12:Update update project.
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: The racoon daemon in IPsec-Tools 0.8.2 contains a remotely exploitable computational-complexity attack when parsing and storing ISAKMP fragments. The implementation permits a remote attacker to exhaust computational resources on the remote endpoint by repeatedly sending ISAKMP fragment packets in a particular order such that the worst-case computational complexity is realized in the algorithm utilized to determine if reassembly of the fragments can take place.
